characters.name: Spike
characters.description:
Spike, also known as Spike the Dragon,[note 1] is a male "pre-teen"[4][note 2] dragon and one of the seven[5] main characters[6] of My Little Pony Friendship is Magic. He is Twilight Sparkle's best friend and number one assistant. He has the ability to magically deliver scrolls to and from Princess Celestia with his fire breath, which features in many episodes, as does his crush on Rarity.

In the season eight episode Molt Down, Spike gains a pair of wings after undergoing a developmental stage for dragons called the "molt".

characters.name:
Violet Dragon
Backdraft
characters.description: One of several teenage dragons featured in Dragon Quest. Also appears in Gauntlet of Fire, in Celestial Advice, in Shadow Play - Part 1, in School Daze - Part 2, in Sweet and Smoky, in Between Dark and Dawn, in The Ending of the End - Part 2, in The Last Problem, in a dream in Friends Forever Issue #14 page 1, and in a photograph in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique Ep. 3. Partly resembles Clumpâ€”sometimes moreso than usualâ€”and to a lesser extent Sludge. He is a characterâ€”first named "Vex" (non-playable), later called "Violet Dragon" (playable)â€”in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "Living proof that not ALL purple-colored dragons are as friendly as Spike is." Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #13 C names him "Backdraft" and states, "Ask Backdraft a question and you might be there for a while."

characters.name:
Dragon 2
Barry
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire as a competitor in the Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header. Also appears in Uprooted, Sweet and Smoky, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and The Last Problem. Shares his design with S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #2. Voiced by Matt Cowlrick.

characters.name:
Tangerine Dragon
Billy
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire as a competitor in the Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 1 with a speaking role, in Uprooted, in Sweet and Smoky, in The Ending of the End - Part 2, and in The Last Problem. Shares his design with S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #3. He is a character called "Tangerine Dragon" in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "This dragon's a 'big-mouth' despite not talking all that much! Get it? 'Big Mouth'?! Yeah, he's heard that joke too many times, too." Identified as Fume in Sweet and Smoky's closing credits, but named Billy in VITAC closed captioning. Voiced by Nicole Oliver. [1][2][specify]

characters.name: Blacktip
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #61 and Issue #62 as the official dragon archivist at the Convocation of Creatures. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as an enemy minion during the "Convocation of the Creatures!" event. His bio states, "This dragon academic can be a bit smug about his species' long and storied history -- but his library science skills are on point."

characters.name: Burnferno
characters.description: Alluded to in A Flurry of Emotions and Father Knows Beast. The protagonist of the book Burnferno: Warrior From Within.

characters.name: Caldera
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire as a competitor in the Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header, in Celestial Advice, in Sweet and Smoky, in The Ending of the End - Part 2, in The Last Problem, and in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #56. Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #69 U names him and states, "Caldera has some anger issues, even by dragon standards."

characters.name:
Charcoal Dragon
Charcoal
characters.description: One of several teenage dragons featured in Dragon Quest. Also appears in Gauntlet of Fire, in Celestial Advice, in Shadow Play - Part 1, in Uprooted, in The Ending of the End - Part 2, in a dream in Friends Forever Issue #14 page 1, on My Little Pony: Nightmare Knights Issue #1 page 14, and in the Signature My Little Pony magazine issue 69 comic Daring friends and the missing story! He is a character called "Charcoal Dragon" in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "'Charcoal' here refers to both this dragon's color, AND what he turns marshmallows into when he breathes on them." Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #30 C names him with a trademark symbol and states, "Most wouldn't guess, but Charcoal fancies himself to be a bit of a chef. Less surprising is that his favorite way to prepare food is a flambÃ©."

characters.name:
Pink Dragon
Cinders
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire as a competitor in the Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 1, Uprooted, Sweet and Smoky, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and The Last Problem. Shares her design with S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #6. She is a character called "Pink Dragon" in Gameloft's mobile game; her bio states, "She still doesn't get why EVERYDRAGON doesn't just balance on their tail when they're sitting down -- like she does! Legs are for posers!" Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #14 C names her and quotes, "Balancing on your tail is WAY better than standing. Legs are for losers."

characters.name:
Russet Dragon
Clump
characters.description: One of several teenage dragons featured in Dragon Quest. Also appears in Gauntlet of Fire, in Celestial Advice, in Sweet and Smoky, in The Ending of the End - Part 2, and on the Chaos is Magic poster. Partly resembles Backdraftâ€”sometimes moreso than usualâ€”and Sludge. He is a character called "Russet Dragon" in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "The best fire-belcher in his social circle, this guy's up for stealing phoenix eggs the MINUTE somedragon dares him to." Named in Sweet and Smoky's closing credits. Voiced by Richard Ian Cox.

characters.name: Crackle
characters.description: An oddly-shaped dragon who appears in Dragon Quest. Twilight, Rainbow Dash, and Rarity's dragon disguise is believed to be her cousin. Also appears in Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header, on the Season 2 poster, and in a photograph in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 3. Her Enterplay series 2 trading and Absolute Discord CCG cards reveal her to be female.

characters.name: Ember
characters.description: Ember is a dragon princess and supporting character who first appears in the season six episode Gauntlet of Fire. She is the current Dragon Lord of the Dragon Lands, succeeding her father Torch.

characters.name:
Pale Dragon
Fizzle
characters.description: One of several teenage dragons featured in Dragon Quest. Also appears in Gauntlet of Fire, in Celestial Advice, in Uprooted, and in the Signature My Little Pony magazine issue 69 comic Daring friends and the missing story! Voiced by Hiroshi Shirokuma in Japanese. He is a character called "Pale Dragon" in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "This dragon is optimized for camouflage against a cloudy sky... and being kind of a jerk to Spike."

characters.name: Flashfire
characters.description: Alluded to in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #14, in flashback in Issue #21, and in Gameloft's mobile game. The protagonist of the comic book Flashfire.

characters.name:
Purple Dragon
Fume
characters.description: One of several teenage dragons featured in Dragon Quest. Also appears in Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header, in Celestial Advice, in Sweet and Smoky, in The Ending of the End - Part 2, on the Chaos is Magic poster, in flashback in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #21, on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #69's cover B, and in a photograph in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique Ep. 3. He is a characterâ€”first named "Fume" (non-playable), later called "Purple Dragon" (playable)â€”in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "A long-time member of Garble's crowd, this dragon has a schoolyard taunt for every occasion -- and bangs for somedragon with a MUCH larger face." Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #16 R names him with a trademark symbol and states, "Bad breath doesn't cover the half of it." Voiced by Matt Hill. [3][4][specify]

characters.name: Garble
characters.description: Garble is a male teenage dragon and Smolder's older brother. He first appears in Dragon Quest as the leader of a gang of dragon bullies that Spike encounters. He is not named in Dragon Quest, but he is named in the episode's script,[2] in Gauntlet of Fire and other episodes onward, and in other materials.

characters.name: Gnash
characters.description: A Sand Dragon accidentally woken from his hibernation in Beyond Equestria: Fluttershy Balances the Scales. Named like G1 My Little Pony The Quest of the Princess Ponies character G'nash.

characters.name: Gostir
characters.description: dragons is featured in the show. One of them, Spike, is one of the main characters in the series. A prominent dragon-like creature, Steven Magnet, is referred to as a sea serpent, and there is another dragon-like creature referred to as a hydra. The other dragons resemble classical European dragons, with large bodies, long necks and tails, scales, and bat-like wings.

characters.name: Knuckerbocker
characters.description: A dragon that helps Daring Do reach the Isles of Scaly in chapter 10 of Daring Do and the Eternal Flower, "Travel the Scales". An illustration at the beginning of the book depicts him and Gallant True with different color schemes than in the story. Also mentioned in A Matter of Principals.

characters.name:
Dragon 1
Maar
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire as a competitor in the Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header. Also appears in Celestial Advice, in Shadow Play - Part 1, in Uprooted, in Sweet and Smoky, in Between Dark and Dawn, in The Ending of the End - Part 2, in The Last Problem, in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #55, and in Issue #56. She is a character called "Lavender Dragon" in Gameloft's mobile game; her bio states, "Even though her shot at being Dragon Lord passed her by, she STILL wishes burps were an official greeting. She's thinking of petitioning Ember about it!" Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #18 C names her and quotes, "BUUURP! What? I was just saying 'Hi!'." Voiced by Nicole Oliver.

characters.name: Mina
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #14, in flashback in Issue #21, on Friendship is Magic Issue #58 page 4, and on My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #5 page 7. The manager of a comic book store in Fillydelphia's Dragon Town and a big fan of Princess Luna. Shares her name with a cat. [5][specify] She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game; her bio states, "This Fillydelphia native is used to being a dragon-out-of-water among ponies. Good thing she has her community -- and her love of comics -- to keep her centered."

characters.name: Razer
characters.description: dragons is featured in the show. One of them, Spike, is one of the main characters in the series. A prominent dragon-like creature, Steven Magnet, is referred to as a sea serpent, and there is another dragon-like creature referred to as a hydra. The other dragons resemble classical European dragons, with large bodies, long necks and tails, scales, and bat-like wings.

characters.name: Rex
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire as a competitor in the Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 1, Uprooted, Sweet and Smoky, The Ending of the End - Part 2, and The Last Problem. Shares his design with S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #4.

characters.name: Scales
characters.description: A dragon whose story is told by Smolder in The Hearth's Warming Club. Also appears on Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #34 U. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and is mentioned during the "Presentable in Periwinkle" event. Her bio states, "A legendary guest at the Feast of Fire -- who became the legendary usurper of the Dragon Lord's throne shortly thereafter."

characters.name:
Fire Guardian
Scalio
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire as a competitor in the Gauntlet of Fire. Also appears in Celestial Advice, School Daze - Part 2, Sweet and Smoky, and The Ending of the End - Part 2, and first named in The Curse of the Statuettes. He is a character called "Aquamarine Dragon" in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "If the phrase 'large and in charge' were applied to a dragon, this guy would definitely be... at least one of those things." Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #35 C names him with a trademark symbol and quotes Garble, "The last time Scalio was grinning like that, my gorge board somehow got painted bright pink. Eww."

characters.name: Scaly Sue
characters.description: Mentioned in Friends Forever Issue #14. The writer of the comic book Flashfire. References Kelly Sue DeConnick.

characters.name: Scintilla
characters.description: A Dragon Lord mentioned in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #56 as having made peace with the yaks and given the title of "honorary yak" by Prince Ulysses.

characters.name: Scorchy
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #56 carrying Spike to Ember, Maar, and Caldera.

characters.name: Sergio
characters.description: A conceited dragon that Queen Chrysalis tricks into releasing her and her changelings from imprisonment inside a volcano.

characters.name: Sludge
characters.description: Sludge is a male dragon who appears as the antagonist of the season eight episode Father Knows Beast, pretending to be Spike's father. He is named Shale in some merchandise.

characters.name: Smolder
characters.description: Smolder is a female dragon, Garble's younger sister, and one of the Young Six[1][2][3] who first appears in season eight of the show as a student at Twilight Sparkle's School of Friendship.

characters.name: Snake
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire as a competitor in the Gauntlet of Fire, in Celestial Advice, in Sweet and Smoky, and in The Ending of the End - Part 2.

characters.name: Spike
characters.description: An alternate universe version of Spike who appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #19.

characters.name: Spike
characters.description: An alternate universe version of Spike who appears in Nightmare Knights Issue #3

characters.name: Torch
characters.description: The former Dragon Lord and Ember's father in Gauntlet of Fire. Also appears in Celestial Advice, Campfire Tales, and Father Knows Beast, on Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria #12 SR and Friends Forever #60 U, and in The Elements of Harmony Volume II. Also mentioned in Sweet and Smoky. Voiced by Matt Cowlrick.

characters.name: Viverno
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire as a competitor in the Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 1, Sweet and Smoky, and The Ending of the End - Part 2. Shares his design with S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #5. A similar dragon appears in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #55 and Issue #56.

characters.name: Whip
characters.description: One of several teenage dragons featured in Dragon Quest. Also appears in Gauntlet of Fire and a related My Little Pony Facebook April Fools' Day header.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #1
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest. Resembles S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #2.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #2
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest and Celestial Advice. Shares design with S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #3, S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #4, and S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #5 and resembles S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #1. A similar dragon appears on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #77's cover RI.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #3
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest. Shares design with S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #2, S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #4, and S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #5.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #4
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest. Shares design with S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #2, S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #3, and S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #5.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #5
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest. Shares design with S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #2, S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #3, and S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #4 and resembles S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #9.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #6
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest. Shares design with S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #7 and S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #8.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #7
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest and Celestial Advice. Shares design with S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #6 and S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #8 and resembles S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #11.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #8
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest. Shares design with S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #6 and S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #7.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #9
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest and Celestial Advice. Resembles S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #5.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #10
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest. Shares design with Razer, "Gostir", and S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #11.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #11
characters.description: Appears in Dragon Quest. Shares design with Razer, "Gostir", and S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #10 and resembles S02E21 Unnamed Dragon #7.

characters.name: S07E16 Unnamed Dragon
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales menacing the Royal Legion. Similar in appearance to "Gostir".

characters.name: S08E01 Unnamed Dragon
characters.description: Impersonated by Ocellus in School Daze - Part 1, Uprooted, and Student Counsel. Appears and mentions having a son in a UK MLP magazine[specify] comic[specify]/Egmont's Polish My Little Pony magazine issue 6/19 comic "Zamieszanie na szczycie".

characters.name:
Ancient Dragon Lord
S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #1
characters.description: Appears in Smolder's story as a former Dragon Lord in The Hearth's Warming Club. He is a character called "Ancient Dragon Lord" in Gameloft's mobile game. His bio states, "The legendary host of the very first Feast of Fire. Legendary for how easy he was to overthrow, mostly. ...Dragon holidays are weird."

characters.name: S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #2
characters.description: Appears in Smolder's story in The Hearth's Warming Club. Shares his design with "Barry".

characters.name: S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #3
characters.description: Appears in Smolder's story in The Hearth's Warming Club. Shares his design with Billy.

characters.name: S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #4
characters.description: Appears in Smolder's story in The Hearth's Warming Club. Shares his design with "Rex".

characters.name: S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #5
characters.description: Appears in Smolder's story in The Hearth's Warming Club. Shares his design with "Viverno".

characters.name: S08E15 Unnamed Dragon #6
characters.description: Appears in Smolder's story in The Hearth's Warming Club. Shares her design with Cinders.

characters.name:
Spike's hypothetical mother
S08E24 Unnamed Dragon
characters.description: Spike's hypothetical mother. Mentioned by Spike in Winter Wrap Up, by Clump in Dragon Quest, and by Spike in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #53. Appears in Sludge's story in Father Knows Beast. "Who knows? As long as the show continues, anything is possible."[specify] "Itâ€™s not been discussed."[specify]

characters.name: S09E09 Unnamed Baby Dragon #1
characters.description: Appears in Sweet and Smoky as one of the baby dragons hatched from dragon eggs.

characters.name: S09E09 Unnamed Baby Dragon #2
characters.description: Appears in Sweet and Smoky as one of the baby dragons hatched from dragon eggs.

characters.name: S09E09 Unnamed Baby Dragon #3
characters.description: Appears in Sweet and Smoky as one of the baby dragons hatched from dragon eggs.

characters.name: S09E09 Unnamed Baby Dragon #4
characters.description: Appears in Sweet and Smoky as one of the baby dragons hatched from dragon eggs.

characters.name: S09E09 Unnamed Baby Dragon #5
characters.description: Appears in Sweet and Smoky as one of the baby dragons hatched from dragon eggs.

characters.name: S09E09 Unnamed Baby Dragon #6
characters.description: Appears in Sweet and Smoky as one of the baby dragons hatched from dragon eggs.

characters.name: Issue 52 Unnamed Dragon
characters.description: A dragon that appears in a Canterlot Museum exhibit in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #52 and comes to life in Issue #53.

characters.name: Friends Forever Issue 14 Unnamed Dragon
characters.description: Appears on My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #14 pages 8, 17, 19, 20, and 21, My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #58 page 4, and My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #5 page 12.

characters.name: Legends of Magic Issue 9 Unnamed Dragon
characters.description: The leader of a flock of dragons confronted by Flash Magnus in My Little Pony: Legends of Magic Issue #9 and Issue #10.
